page.title: 09 "FARMING"
page.content: The summer of 1985 has been one of the wettest in living memory. As a result the harvest was three weeks later than the average for the area. Much of the grain had to be dried prior to storage, the moisture content being very high. The majority of farms within the area are still farmed as either dairy or arable units, most farms becoming highly mechanised over the last 20-30 years. Tractors are larger and in many cases 4-wheel drive. Combine harvesters have become larger on the predominantly arable farms. Round bailers have appeared on the scene recently to bail straw, hay and silage The area has seen a limited removal of some dividing field hedges but has remained essentially unaltered over the years.
